function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Limited width of inner-city sidewalks makes it spatially difficult to maintain personal distance during COVID-19 restrictions.","Impact":"Increased risk of close contact and potential spread of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Expansion of sidewalk width or implementation of alternative pedestrian routes.","Technologies":"Urban planning and design technologies to optimize sidewalk space.","People":"City residents, pedestrians, commuters.","Owner":"City planning authorities, urban development organizations."},{"Description":"Low supply of public green space per person in Viennese districts.","Impact":"Limited outdoor space for recreation and physical activity, potentially leading to overcrowding in existing green spaces.","Mitigation":"Development of new public green spaces, renovation and expansion of existing parks, creation of urban green infrastructure.","Technologies":"Green space planning tools, urban landscape design technologies.","People":"City residents, park visitors, local community.","Owner":"City authorities, park management organizations."},{"Description":"Limited accessibility to publicly accessible open spaces, especially in densely built-up districts in Vienna.","Impact":"Under-supply of open spaces, potential overcrowding in available parks, and decreased access to outdoor recreational areas.","Mitigation":"Improvement of open space accessibility, creation of new public open spaces, and development of community green areas.","Technologies":"GIS mapping tools for open space accessibility, urban planning technology for open space integration.","People":"Viennese residents, local community members.","Owner":"City planning authorities, urban development organizations."},{"Description":"Limited availability of private or partially public open spaces, such as green terraces and balconies, in densely built-up areas of Vienna.","Impact":"Restricted access to private outdoor spaces for recreational activities and limited opportunities for residents to enjoy open air environments.","Mitigation":"Incorporation of green spaces in building designs, promotion of communal open spaces, and creation of green infrastructure in residential areas.","Technologies":"Architectural design technologies for green space integration, community engagement platforms for green space development.","People":"Residents of densely built-up areas, apartment dwellers.","Owner":"Property developers, architectural firms, community organizations."}]}
